titleStmt.title: Account [about 248-246 BC]
titleStmt.author: Zenon, son of Agreophon, of Caunus, 1 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 332-333

msContents.summary: Account presenting Zenon's estimate of the balance between the cost of labor and gross production from the estate of Apollonios: it covers an entire year; the employees are divided into four groups: regular agents and servants, hired hands, people hired on a monthly basis, and specialized vinedressers; the total net is drawn and then erased in line 37

msItemStruct.note: 37 lines written along the fibers; on the back, across the fibers, is the docket
The back is written by a second hand
Written in a tiny, proficient hand, either Zenon's or his special clerk's; see P.Col.III 58 and 59 and IV 72, and p. 40

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; nos. 46 (original no. 2) and 24 (original no. 36) in Bell's inventory

Balance sheet of a large estate

Franko, BASP 25 (1988) 68-70, dates to 249-248 or later, and considers the writing on the back without relation to the front and perhaps older; explanation of line 15 (the totals were not simply arithmetic errors) and correction to line 21 by Clarysse, personal communication.
